choice.text: [Federation Database] Learn about the storage menu.
Recruit some unique crew to talk to them.
You're concerned about Ellie's mental state. Check in on her.
Ellie's mental state is concerning, but right now, there are bigger matters to take into account.
You cannot use an augment here.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LEARN
event.text: At various opportunities you will be given the option to check your storage and do various actions onboard your ship. This can happen in situations such as visiting stores, revisiting an explored beacon, or choosing not to interact with an event. It may look overwhelming at first, but eventually you'll become accustomed to the system. To learn about internal upgrades or the onboard lab, visit the database entries under their respective tabs.

Here you may view accomplishments throughout the run and lore entries related to them. The mission report tracks bosses defeated, Renegades encountered, loot items found, and unique crew recruited. The mission report provides no practical benefit but can provide insight on just what you've done along your journey!

You may also choose to engage in various tasks. By default, you'll be able to run salvage missions and repair your hull, but if you find a Mine Launcher weapon you can also lay a trap for the fleet before sector 8. Salvage missions have many different outcomes, some good and some bad, but can turn up valuable loot. Repairing the hull may be less efficient than at a store, but it can get you out of a tight spot.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_INSTALL
event.text: The onboard lab can be used to install upgrades for your crew. You can install the lab for free with a level 2 Medbay, otherwise you must use additional resources.

choice.text: [Federation Database] Learn about the onboard lab.
(Upg. Medbay) Install the lab for free.
(Alkali) Install the lab and its upgrade for free.

event.text: You install the lab.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_UPGRADE
event.text: Upgrading the lab will allow you to access secondary upgrades for crew, which apply buffs to specific subtypes of crew. With level 3 Medbay, you can install the upgrade for free.

choice.text: (Adv. Medbay) Install the upgrade for free.

event.text: You install the upgrade.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_LEARN
event.text: The onboard lab, once installed, allows you to install modifications for species and specific crew types. You must have at least one crew of that species to be able to install modifications for it. Unless specified otherwise, all modifications apply retroactively and to crew gained after the modification was installed. Lab modifications come in two forms, primary and secondary.

Primary modifications apply to all crew of a specific species. However, you can only have one primary modification installed per species, and cannot uninstall modifications. Each species has exactly 3 options for primary upgrades, all of which are available as long as you have the lab installed and at least one crew of that species.

choice.text: Learn about the lab upgrade and secondary modifications.

event.text: Once you've installed the lab you may upgrade it once more to unlock secondary modifications. Unlike primary mods, secondary mods only apply to specific crew types. No crew type has more than one secondary mod, and you may install multiple secondaries under the same species. You do not need a crew member of that subtype to install a secondary for it.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB
event.text: Please select a species you want to upgrade or view currently installed modifications for.

choice.text: [Federation Database] Learn about the onboard lab.
You have upgraded the lab to level 2.

Currently Installed: Teamwork Neurons. [+15% stacking buff to combat damage and repair speed for each other allied human in the room]
Currently Installed: Natural Intuition. [New human crew start at level 2 skills]
Pri: Diversification. [An upgrade is already installed]
Pri: Teamwork Neurons. [An upgrade is already installed]
Pri: Natural Intuition. [An upgrade is already installed]

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_HUMAN_DIVERSIFICATION
event.text:
You are about to install the Diversification modification. [Effects: +12% buff to movement speed, combat damage, repair speed, and health]
[Warning: After installing this, you will not be able to install any more primary upgrades for Human crew. You will not be able to deactivate this mod either.]
You install the modification.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_HUMAN_TEAMWORK
event.text:
You are about to install the Teamwork Neurons modification. [Effects: Gain a stacking 15% buff to combat damage and repair speed for each other allied human in the same room]
[Warning: After installing this, you will not be able to install any more primary upgrades for Human crew. You will not be able to deactivate this mod either.]
You install the modification.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_HUMAN_INTUITION
event.text:

[Warning: After installing this, you will not be able to install any more primary upgrades for Human crew. You will not be able to deactivate this mod either.]
You install the modification.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_HUMAN_BASIC_SACRIFICE
event.text:

[Warning: This will affect regular Human Crew only. You will be able to install other secondary mods and primary mods afterwards.]

choice.text: You must have the lab upgrade for this modification.

[Warning: This will affect Medic Crew only. You will be able to install other secondary mods and primary mods afterwards.]
You install the modification.

You install the modification.

Currently active grant: Grant of Doors Your crew gain 30% damage resistance while in the Door Control room. The system gains 50% sabotage resistance.
Currently active grant: Grant of Battery When battery is disabled, your crew gain 33% repair and movement speed.
Currently active grant: Grant of Time Your crew gain doubled movement speed.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Crystals Your hull has a 15% chance to break off a crystal shard when taking damage.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Traps No passive effect.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Speciality Your weapons charge 5% faster.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Transports Enemy FTL Drives charge at half speed.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Mathematics For each crew member in a room, they will gain a 4% boost to their health and repair speed.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Renegades You can avoid any hostile Renegade encounter, including bosses, for free.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Tasks C.U.R.A. will not charge the usual 30 scrap fee to accept tasks.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Sentries Your allied crew and drones gain 30% damage and movement speed aboard the enemy ship.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Super Weapons Your weapons charge 10% faster.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Merchants When trading with Sylvan, you will be given a choice between 3 random trade sets.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Generations All new crew will start with at least level 1 in all skills.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Aether Precursor ruins will now display on the map whenever present.
Currently active blessing: Blessing of Poets Inflicts madness on enemy boarders.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_INVENTORY_UPGRADES
event.text: You are currently viewing all installed internal upgrades.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_INVENTORY_LAB
event.text: You are currently viewing all installed internal upgrades.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM_LEARN
event.text: Internal Upgrades carry many different passive functions similar to augments, but can be installed at any storage check and do not fill augment slots. Internal augments do not always cost just scrap. As you purchase more systems (or fill other requirements) more options will appear. Some internal upgrades may be mutually exclusive with other upgrades. You can select an internal augment to preview a description of its function before purchasing it.

While somewhat rare outside of starting configurations for certain ships, you may sometimes find special augments marked with an [X]. These augments will provide their function normally as an augment, but can be converted to the internal version for free under the purchase menu. External augments do not count towards mutually exclusive upgrades or upgrade limits. However, once you exchange them for their internal version they will, so be careful! Converting an external augment to internal cannot be undone.

choice.text: Learn about arms and modular [M] variants.

event.text: Under the internal upgrade menu you can also install and uninstall arms. Each arm has a different effect, but you can only have one at a time. Uninstalling arms gives back half of the price to install it. Similar to external augments, you can find Modular Arms marked by an [M] on rare occasions. Modular arms do not count towards the arm limit but take an augment slot. However, Modular Arms cannot be internalized. The arm menu is located under "Onboard Tech".

choice.text: "Ssstranger... if your room isss anything like the ssstate you let thissss ssship be, I am deeply disssappointed in you."

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_AUG_ANCIENT_ACTIVATOR
event.text: Are you sure you want to do this?

choice.text: Awaken the alien using the activator and some fuel.

event.text: You activate the key and slide it into the Ancient. The robotic being stirs to life, as 4 cubes raise off the ground and begin to orbit around it. Its singular eye, if you could call it that, lights up and immediately begins to scan the surrounding area.

event.name: ANCIENT_LORE_DUMP
event.text:
The creature begins to speak in the same garbled way as the Auto-scout before but stops. It scans the area where your translator is located, and the device lights up. You look at your translator to find its database entries have been updated even further - expanding on the entries given to you by the Augmented.
NOTE FROM THE DEVS: This questline is old and is currently planned for a total rework in a future update. Due to the large number of unlocks tied to it, we have left it in the game, but the questline is no longer considered canon.

The alien speaks again. "Language Calibration: Complete. Hello, strange creature. I have taken the liberty of updating your translator to understand our spoken language. You have done me a great service, though I know you probably had no idea what you were doing. The closest pronunciation of my name in your language is Aenwithe, but I suspect that might be a mouthful. I recommend you call me Wither, as my true dialect would make your head explode if attempted to be pronounced."

"I am sure you have plenty of questions, and I would be happy to answer any I can. Would you care for the long story, or the short story? I assure you, the long one is much more interesting than the short one, and I only recommend listening to the short one if you've heard this all before. Er, forgive me for my fourth wall breaking, I am not quite sure how else to say this."

"Ok then, well where to start... As I have said, my name is Aenwithe. Though my species's given name would translate to something similar to 'Ancient', it's probably easier to refer to us as the Obelisks. Our race has been around for far longer than most, the only other competitors we had in our glory days were the Crystals, the Dynasty, and the Lanius."

"We have been divided culturally by centuries between the Commoners and the Royals, who are biologically much stronger than us and as such the natural leaders, a fact which most of us accept without complaint. We were not always these cubical mechanical things you see now, but the Royal's drive for perfection led to our need to perfect everything we had. Our organic bodies were left behind in favor of these, factoring out any weaknesses like disease or aging."

"Though our new bodies struggle at repairing or construction due to a lack of limbs, we've already come to rely mostly on drone technology to serve us. Though our society might sound Utopian, it's anything but. Most of our population is sick and twisted, their egos so large they've come to believe that we are actual gods. This desire to play with life has led to some technological achievements you probably couldn't comprehend."

"The Engi race with which you are so familiar is merely a byproduct of an Obelisk cognitive AI, one which is truly sentient, known as the Harmony. When our civilization fell, the Harmony was released into the world and eventually became what it is today. Several other achievements of ours I've noticed have found their way into your society, such as the Zoltan's beloved Great Eye, which is merely a malfunctioning Reality Manipulator of ours. I might even had repaired it for them, had my fleet not been decimated."

"However, our biggest and grandest achievement beyond all else is none other than the Multiverse Drive themselves. See, after our exploitative nature of the universe around us started to catch up to us and we suddenly found our reality dry of the resources we had used up, we sought a way to fix it... by invading other realities for their resources instead. We didn't expect much resistance, until we found more of ourselves on the other end."

"Perhaps if we had been different we could have achieved some grand inter-reality civilization, but instead we followed through with our intent and waged war against ourselves. This was devastating, and within only a few decades, our species had been reduced to a shadow of its former glory. The survivors realized the futility of continuing to battle, and so we sealed ourselves away with the use of a waystone, a device which can disconnect a sector from the usual grid that FTL drives operate with."

"And so, this brings us to where we are now. We have remained locked away for centuries, slowly rebuilding our empire. The Royals have built several planet-sized vaults around some of our ruined sectors, and intend to use the supplies inside to launch a massive invasion of the reality you've deemed Universe 0, and eventually the rest of the Multiverse as well."

"I am part of a resistance group who aims to prevent the Royals from going through with their plans. To do this, we intend to use a specialized bomb called the Paragon. The force of its detonation should be so powerful it will not only decimate the Obelisk Homeworlds, but sever the connection between realities, rendering MV tech useless. That's why my fleet came here, to recover the last part we need to construct this weapon. However, the Lanius you saw destroyed it when they attacked us."

"If you say so. I am part of an ancient civilization from long before any that you know of. Our species doomed ourselves to a point of near extinction after the Multiverse tech we invented led to a massive intraspecies war. We disappeared from the galactic scene ages ago, but now we've managed to crawl back. Our leaders, the Obelisk Royals, are planning to invade and retake Universe 0, and inevitably the rest of the Multiverse using massive stockpiles of supplies kept in several planet-sized vaults. I am part of a small but competent resistance group, and we are working on a prototype bomb called the Paragon. Its detonation will be so powerful that it will not only decimate the entire Obelisk Homeworlds, but collapse the Multiverse itself, shutting down MV drives everywhere. I came here to collect one of the last fragments needed, but those Lanius destroyed it along with my fleet."
"Ah, I see you have already encountered me from another timeline. Very well then, I'm sure you understand the situation. Shall we head to the Obelisk sector now, or do you have other things to do?"
"Most excellent. I suggest finding somewhere to sit or something to hold on to, this will be a bumpy ride!"

"Understandable. Well, I must continue my journey then. I request that you drop me off at the nearest habitable location where I might find a ship. Now for your payment, hopefully these optimizations will make up for it..."

event.name: ANCIENT_LORE_DUMP_CHALLENGE
event.text: "Not all is lost however. There's another sector whose vault is suspected to contain a similar component we can use. From what I have gathered from my stay here, I believe my goal is mutually beneficial for both of us. This bomb will save this reality from Rebel invasions, and could be the key to ending this war of yours. I understand if you don't wish to help however, you have already done more than enough by just awakening me. Should you decline, I will find some other way to pay you."
"Really? Most excellent. I suggest finding somewhere to sit or something to hold on to, this will be a bumpy ride!"

"Understandable. Well, I must continue my journey then. I request that you drop me off at the nearest habitable location where I might find a ship. Now for your payment, hopefully these optimizations will make up for it..."

A brilliant light fills the ship, and you feel a great joy overtake you. Everything feels like bliss, like everything will be ok. When you snap out of your trance, you find the ship has been remarkably better stocked than it was before.

A dark gloom consumes the ship, overwhelming your senses with the sounds of screams and the scent of rotting flesh. When the gloom has gone away, the ship is in horrible disrepair, and you are haunted by a feeling of regret.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_FAIL
event.text: Ellie growls at you as you approach, clutching her knife firmly in one hand. You stop before getting too close, realizing she must be furious you failed to clear off her precious list. You make a brief apology and head off before she can do anything drastic.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_BUSY
event.text: Ellie stares at you blankly when you approach and says nothing. You try to talk to her but she stops you. "Captain, why are you here? Don't you have... THINGS to be doing? Did you forget your promise? Go. Get. Them. Done. Pleeeeasssse?" Ellie smiles innocently.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_1
event.text: You find Ellie giggling to herself in the corner. As you approach, she perks up. "Oh superfan, I have a requeeeeeesssst of you!" Ellie pulls out a long list and hands it to you. "This is my super-duper revenge list! It's all the people who I want to put. In. The. Ground. For taking the Ellie show off-air! Deranged lunatics, Rebel supporters, probably fascist psychomurderer bad guys! You already promised me you'd help." Ellie clasps her hands together and bats her fake eyelashes uncomfortably close to your face. "So, when do we get started?"

event.name: ELLIE_1_START
event.text: Ellie smiles and points to the first name on the list. "Rigley Spruce, head of merchandising for Flower and Sunshine Studios! He was the first weak link... they cut all of my merchandise before they gave me the boot, because they thought the children would forget about me! Who could forget their FAVORITE childhood character? I'm the best character in all of media history! I'm fabulous to my very core! Rigley's a fat, alcoholic, piece of little rotten... uhm... woops, that's not very PG. He's a bad guy, okay? He was part of Vance's little riot group back before the Civil War too! We're going to start with him..."

choice.text: Have you considered not murdering these people?

event.text: Ellie blinks and laughs. "Hahah. No."
"Soooo... are you going to help?"

choice.text: I'm not comfortable doing this right now.
I'm not comfortable doing this right now.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_2
event.text: You find Ellie sorting through some merchandise she stole from the warehouse. You don't remember her doing that but you don't bother asking. When she finally notices you watching her, she looks up and smiles the same menacing smile once again. "Ready for another, superfan? We did super fantasticalicious last time, and I can't WAIT to get another off my list!" She makes a horse noise and pretends to prance around.

event.name: ELLIE_2_START
event.text: Ellie pulls out her list again, which you notice now to have been hastily scribbled on the back of a receipt. "Hum, let's see! OH, of course! Old Hueghey Armstrong! Chief legal consultant for Flower and Sunshine Studios. He was always so boooooorrrrring! Yap yap yap, all he did was talk about mumbo jumbo legal stuff. Children aren't entertained by LAW! They're entertained by ELLIE THE EQUINOID! But of course, you know that superfan! He was also on... uhm... I think he did some stuff for Vance? Bah he's probably a human supremacist! Ellie doesn't like human supremacists. Ellie loves all creatures equally! So long as they understand that Ellie belongs on the air! For the people to see! Well... what are you waiting for? Let's go!"

choice.text: Was cutting off Rigley's hand necessary?

event.text: "Yes." Ellie doesn't hesitate for a moment.

choice.text: What was that paper you grabbed from his desk?

event.text: "Doesn't matter. Stop procrastinating superfan, and just say you're going to help me!" Ellie frowns.

choice.text: I'm not comfortable doing this right now.
I'm not comfortable doing this right now.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_3
event.text: You find Ellie staring at a pack of stolen cigarettes in her hand, pondering them deeply. When she notices you, she stashes them in her suit and spins around in a circle. "Another day, another entry on the liiiiiissssst to cross off! Yippee! I am super duper franticalasticly excited for the next one!"

event.name: ELLIE_3_START
event.text: "We're going after my old ex-friend Remmy the Rekma! He plays poker with some friends at a local establishment, and we're going to crash his littttlllle PAAARTY! Hahah! He was always so funny with his goofy accent and those big ears of his, too bad he didn't have my back when I was sacked! I saw that little traitorous neerdowell shaking hands with Sammy and welcoming him onto the cast the week before I got the pink slip! And traitors deserve a little payback, don't you think?"

choice.text: Was burning down that office necessary?

event.text: "Of course it was silly! Hueghey did all sorts of evil things! He was practically a supervillain. But he's just too boring to be one."

choice.text: Other people worked at that firm though.

event.text: "And so what? If they were working with Hueghey they deserved it! Bad actions are infectious, you need... you need... stop distracting me! Let's get a move on!" Ellie wavers, as if struggling to defend her actions.

choice.text: I'm not comfortable doing this right now.
I'm not comfortable doing this right now.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_4
event.text: Ellie is whistling the theme song to her own show in perfect rhythm whilst snapping her fingers and bouncing back and forth. "We're almost at the end of the list, superfan! I am soooo excited! EEEEEH! Are you ready?! Like, super duper ready?!"

event.name: ELLIE_4_START
event.text: "Next up is the one and only Paul Lancastor, director of the Ellie the Equinoid show! Well, about to be FORMER director, hahah! The decision to fire me was as much his fault as it was Vance's, and I have a special treat for him!"

choice.text: Killing Gos was probably not the right thing to do.

event.text: Ellie stares at you blankly, barely even breathing. "Who's Gos, silly?"
"Oh! Hahah! Yes. Now, let's move on."

choice.text: I'm not comfortable doing this right now.
I'm not comfortable doing this right now.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_ELLIE_5
event.text: You can't seem to find Ellie in any of her usual spots. Instead, you eventually find her crawled up in the airlock, with the safety features disabled. She looks distraught, but as you approach she climbs to her feet and attempts to regain her standard composure. "Are you ready superfan? We're on the last item on my list! It's gonna be great... the super awesome saucesome kind of great!"

"We're going to be going after Sammy the Spider! That stupid idiot evil monstrous fiend stole my place on the show, outsold my merchandise, and is corrupting the youth with his 'hip and trendy' fads! Rap music? Seriously?! What are they teaching the children?! We're going to get rid of this menace, and when he's out of the way, the show will be mine again! I'll be a star for all the Multiverse to see! Oh isn't it wonderful how close we are?! And when we're done, it'll be a free life's supply of quarp juice and merchandise for you superfan, for bringing me all this way!" Ellie wipes a tear away. "I dare even say... we might be friends?! But we can worry about that later, Sammy must come first!"

choice.text: I'm not comfortable doing this right now.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_COMICS
event.text: You look through your comic books. What do you want to read?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_COMIC_DEVORAK
event.text: The vibrant panels tell the enthralling tale of a Zoltan warrior named Devorak Rei, an underdog soldier stuck in the middle of the Federation-Mantis War fighting for the Ministry alongside Human and Engi companions. In the end, Devorak stands triumphant but scarred from his experiences with the Mantis. Short but sweet, and surprisingly historically accurate.

After the events of the Federation-Mantis War, Devorak is honored by the Ministry as a hero and put in charge of their peacekeeper training program. However, he is left broken after his lost brother Biene is declared dead after having been missing in action for years. This leads to a greater internal struggle when the Federation erected a memorial to Node 17, which listed only the names of the Humans who lost their lives, and nothing of the Zoltan or Engi soldiers who had fought just as valiantly. The comic ends with Devorak struggling with where his allegiances will fall.

The third comic opens straight into the violent turmoil of the Free Mantis genocides, where Devorak witnesses firsthand the Federation's inaction against unjust cruelty towards his people. Finally broken, Devorak turns to a rising Duskbringer movement and begins to recruit new members through the academy at which he teaches. At the end of the comic, the Ministry discovers his secret, and he flees to the Duskbringer Stronghold to escape punishment. A bitter end to the story, but that's about as much of his origins as the Federation knows.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_COMIC_TULLY
event.text: You open the comic to find a fairly accurate retelling of Tully's past. Starting from his birth in the Union, Tully leads an uneventful life within a small industrial mining colony to impoverished parents. Suddenly, he is thrust into the center of the new rising galactic conflict when Mantis invaders destroy his colony and kill everyone he loves, leading to him enlisting in the Union military to fight back against the Mantis threat.

You're surprised to find in the second comic one of Tully's first accomplices is none other than Admiral Vance Wentworth himself! Already a high ranking star-commander, Vance shows Tully the ropes and soon they become fast friends. However, they are split up for some time until Tully is captured during a mission and brought to a central Mantis POW camp where Vance is already being kept. Both are tortured beyond belief but remain resilient and eventually lead a movement against their captors to start their escape, but not without the deaths of several dozen other prisoners.

In the third comic Tully wanders lost throughout the frozen hellscape he is trapped on, saved only just in time by a small band of Mantis scientists taking refuge after having tried to escape the Hive themselves. He meets a young mantis named Tiifleeiiik, who he becomes good friends with, and learns the native Mantis language of Yeitiiik. At the end of the comic, Vance returns to the Federation front-lines and a search party is sent out for Tully, who returns to the Federation safely. This leads to one final assault on Tiet III, the heart of the Mantis war machine, where the Hive surrenders and the Federation is declared the victor.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_COMIC_WAR
event.text: Everyone knows the stories of the Federation-Mantis War, but these comics provide a unique point of view from that of the Leeches, who played a small but important role in the conflict. The story begins with a peaceful day on humanity's homeworlds, Earth. Suddenly, a Mantis invasion descends on the planet, but is defeated by the Human forces along with the power of the Gatling Laser, a revolutionary advancement in technology created by Jackson Newman and produced by Zulfiqar Armaments. Though Earth survives, humankind is shaken and ready for war.

The Mantis continue to aggress the situation, thirsting for conquest, and launch attacks against the Harmony and the Ministry. Frightened, Union Senator Adrian Novikov arranges to meet with the Harmony and Minister Lumei, and together they form a trade alliance known as the Federation. However, in the meantime, conflicts stirring within the Eargen Republic and Floral Gathering lead to the opposing force known as the Trifecta, consisting of the Mantis Hive, the Eargen Republic, and the Vampweed Confederacy.

Now having evolved into a full-scale galactic conflict, both sides lead constant attacks against each other. The conflict goes on for 5 years, with the Hive relying heavily on the support of its two main allies. However, the tides turn when the Vampweeds and Florals signed the treaty of Kadahellian'ek, promising to avoid conflict with each other. Furthermore, a military coup within the Republic led to the public assasination of the former leader Aerkae who had firmly supported the Hive. Without any allies left, the Hive finally surrendered after its defeat during the battle of Tiet III.
