event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_STATUS_MV
event.text: When you eliminate a Multiverse Renegade Cruiser, it will appear here.

CLASS: Kestrel Cruiser FACTION: The Federation
Perhaps the most iconic model still in circulation, the Kestrel was once on the way out, with fewer than a hundred models still in use at the start of the Civil War. After the hero of Universe 0 defeated the Rebel Flagship aboard their own classic Kestrel, a newfound craze took storm of the galaxy and Kestrels began widespread production once again. Almost driving the new prototype Federation cruiser project to death, the two cruisers manage to run in harmony, with the Kestrel now serving a more civilian use for middle-class Union citizens and upstart Renegades.

CLASS: Federation Cruiser FACTION: The Federation
The successor to the preliminary and outdated Kestrel Cruiser, the once unfinished prototype of the Federation Cruiser was recovered during the Civil War after having been stolen by the Rebels and utilized to fashion the Rebel Flagship's infamous artillery. Now in widescale production, the somewhat unfortunate shape of these ships comes secondhand in embarrassment only to the widespread dislike for the unwieldly charge times of the artillery weapons. Thanks to the prosperous wealth of Universe 0 however, newer models feature much more sophisticated technology that has allowed these cruisers to compete with other state of the art ships in the Multiverse era.

CLASS: Stealth Cruiser FACTION: The Federation
The Federation Stealth Brigade is one of the main fruits of the alliance between the Federation and the Harmony, and is part of the reason why their contentious partnership remains strong even today. The first Stealth Cruisers started production during the Civil War, with the neutrality pact between the Harmony and Rebellion serving as a cover for the development of a potentially war-changing ship. Though the war ended long before these ships ever left the manufacturing belt, their strength and subtlety has tipped many battles in the current Multiversal War towards the Federation's favor.

CLASS: Engineer Cruiser FACTION: The Rebellion
The Rebellion's Engineer Corps have gained considerable military tract, mostly a show of dominant strength. In suit, it was only fitting they be given a mighty vessel capable of both immense military strength and utility. The wide-reaching wingspan of the Engineer Cruiser has become iconic, and the glistening paint-job of Engineer vessels is the subject of envy of many an underfunded Federation captain.

CLASS: MV Rebel Cruiser FACTION: The Rebellion
Originally, the interdimensional Rebellion relied primarily on the strength of the local Rebellions of each individual universe to conquer it, though once the Federation started employing the services of Renegades this quickly proved insufficient. With Vance's disdain towards Renegades, the next best choice to fight back against them was to establish a fleet of Multiverse travelling Rebel ships to provide more directed support for targeted universes. Despite the size of the MV Rebel fleet, it consists of surprisingly few cruisers like these, most likely due to the resources required for them instead being spent on mass producing MV Flagships.

CLASS: Tuco's Cruiser FACTION: Rock Outcasts (Owned by Tuco)
The background of the type of vessel used by the Dread Pirate Tuco is almost as storied as its captain's. The ship started its life as a light cruiser developed by Hephaestus for non-combatitive purposes, though when Tiikaka extorted several shipyards from Hephaestus, it was hastily given a proper weapons system. Eventually, Tuco and his future crew claimed it as their own and made their grand escape from a Tiikaka slave camp. Some speculate that Tiikaka still has several similar style ships ready to use, though evidence to support these suggestions is mixed. Also, the specific cruiser Tuco stole was originally intended as a mobile casino, not that it particularly matters now.

CLASS: Harmony Cruiser FACTION: The Engi Harmony
Fashioned from a living swarm of trillions of nanites, the Harmony Cruiser may look like a mound of garbage, but underneath the hood is an extremely efficient network. Many foolish marauders, especially the odd slaver, have mistakenly interpreted the ship's small size as a sign of weakness, but they couldn't be further from the truth. There's many a legend, strange as it may be, of sightings of Harmony Cruisers "mating" and producing smaller ships from the aftermath.

CLASS: Separatist Cruiser FACTION: Engi Separatists
The ships used by the Engi Separatists are similar to those used by the Engi Harmony, even down to rumors of said ships "mating" to form larger vessels. Some debates have been had over whether the reduced crew capacity of these ships is down to the preferences of the Separatists, or to better facilitate their crew drone technology. So far, no clear answer has come from these debates. The design of the cruiser is particularly distinct from that of Harmony Cruisers, which may be a sign of the Separatist movement's strength.

CLASS: Ministry Cruiser FACTION: The Zoltan Ministry
The Ministry legal system has a multitude of laws to uphold, regulations to enforce, borders to patrol, and pirates to attack. The Ministry shipyards optimize cruisers for precision and defense. With such brutal battlefield efficiency, the Ministry tries to minimize upkeep cost, minimize danger to crew and maximize enemy surrenders. The Energy shields they use are famous for affording the frail residents a measure of safety against boarders, protecting them from slavers' tendency to teleport aboard and sell whoever they find.

CLASS: Illesctrian Cruiser FACTION: The Zoltan Ministry
It may seem unusual for the pacifist and non-militaristic monks to carry a warship of this size, but in fact the impressive size and defensive strength of these ships has dissuaded many an otherwise marauder from harming the monks. Built after the genocidal attacks of the Infernals on Monk space, these cruisers now carry entire clergies across the galaxy to spread the words of their faith, as well as serving as sanctuaries for Ministry politicians and refugees.

CLASS: Duskbringer Cruiser FACTION: The Duskbringers
At the start of their rise to infamy, the Duskbringers first used old science vessels stolen from the Ministry. Over time as their identity evolved and the movement gained more traction, the brightest minds of the Duskbringers gathered together and crafted a warship capable of rivaling the Ministry's strongest cruiser. Now the pride and joy of the Duskbringers, many a heated debate has started over the superiority of the vessel.

CLASS: Hive Cruiser FACTION: The Mantis Hive
Near the time of the Federation-Mantis War (when it was still known as the Human-Mantis War)'s beginning, the Hive only employed the use of smaller, mobile vessels for quick deployment. When the war shifted towards later conflicts between fleets thanks to the added might of the Ministry fleet, the Hive began to invest in larger warships. The dreaded Hive Cruiser keeps the maneuverability and sleek build of the original fleet but can fit a larger arsenal and supporting crew.

CLASS: Free Mantis Cruiser FACTION: The Free Mantis
Fashioned haphazardly out of parts of smaller Hive ships by early Free Mantis engineers, this ship is almost older than the movement itself. With the first model being created and captained by the now well known Free Mantis revolutionary Freddy, many Free Mantis have created replicas. Though each version has a few signature differences, the striking accuracy at which the Free Mantis have faithfully recreated their precious cruiser is nothing but a testament to the unstoppable capabilities of a hard determined Mantis.

CLASS: Theocracy Cruiser FACTION: The Rock Theocracy
Compared to most factions, the Theocracy developed cruiser class vessels much earlier. The reasons for this are speculated frequently, though it is often assumed to be due to the Elders at the time overcompensating in their efforts to prevent other rising civilisations threatening their hold over Rock society. This cruiser is not one of these earlier models, but a more compact design that has proven to be easier to produce in bulk, resulting in it being used by more than just the peak of the Theocracy's military.

CLASS: Lost Sun Cruiser FACTION: The Lost Suns
For the first several years of the Lost Sun revolution, their fleet lacked any distinct livery. Upon seeing the unifying power the rather simple but distinct paintjobs used by fellow revolutionaries like the Duskbringers and Free Mantis however, Lost Sun Admiral Ariadne jumped at the opportunity and quickly seized hold of a Theocracy shipyard. Though most Lost Sun vessels are smaller in size, a few cruisers such as these can be seen terrorizing Theocracy fleets with their immense firepower.

CLASS: Imperial Cruiser FACTION: Crystalline Empire
The origins of the initial design of the Imperial Cruiser have been lost to time, though some historians (or wannabe grave robers) claim they can be found sealed away inside the ancient crypt of the distant Emperor Ycathine constructed underneath Wria, the Crystalline Homeworlds. No one really believes this since the vault likely doesn't exist at all, and many people have emerged claiming to be the descendents of the original engineer responsible. This includes a couple Crystal aristocrats, one of Empress Dianesh's 20 times removed cousins, and once a very delusional Leech.

CLASS: Kleptocracy Cruiser FACTION: The Slug Kleptocracy
Though plenty capable in combat, Slug ships tend to be optimized to better facilitate the luxurious and decadent lifestyles of their occupants. Their cruisers are no exception to this rule. The first Kleptocracy Cruiser was given to Slocknog not long after his coronation by a relatively unknown shipbuilding company's CEO, to try and gain favor with the new king. This bribe worked, and they were given permission to construct the rest of the Kleptocracy's fleet. The company soon got in trouble for some of its smaller ships having non-functional doors to their life support systems, and it was discovered afterwards that the cruiser blueprints were in fact stolen. Nowadays Slug ships are much safer, for Slugs at least, since their ships are still lacking in sensory technology.

CLASS: EHG Cruiser FACTION: Exotic Hunter's Guild
Constructed originally by the Kleptocracy as an early model of a light cruiser, engineers soon realized the absurd wingspan of this vessel made it both impractical to maneuver and to store in their traditionally cramped hangars. Though originally planned to be discarded entirely, the original prototype ended up in the hands of one of the earliest Guild rangers, a friend of the residing king Terlack. Taking a liking to the idea of the Guild having an appropriately extravagant cruiser model of their own, full scale production within privately owned shipyards commenced soon-there-after. This little known and only moderately interesting tale is among many of similar stories engraved on Terlack's tomb, which is so long it is believed no mortal Slug could read it within an average lifespan.

CLASS: Lanius Cruiser FACTION: The Swarm
The sweeping blades of the Lanius Cruiser, though once suspected to be some sort of bizzare defensive protrusion, actually appear to be some sort of ritualistic inclusion. Far from spiritual, the Lanius' unique aesthetic seems to be driven by a more natural, innate force. Always well armed, cruisers like these have become a terror for any settler who found themselves too close to the area of influence of the re-emerging Swarm during the Civil War.

CLASS: Gathering Cruiser FACTION: The Floral Gathering
Though the Gathering has several gardenworlds to grow their fleets, few are large enough to be capable of growing these vessels. Even the earliest models of these cruisers utilized the FTL drive technology the Gathering first received from the Theocracy, and were well armed enough to fend off any potential Vampweed offensives. Though ships such as these may seem contrary to the normally pacifist ways of the Florals, it is in fact due to the impressive strength of their cruisers that their peaceful lifestyle is able to withstand the strength of their enemies.

CLASS: Confederate Cruiser FACTION: The Vampweed Confederacy
Ever the more militaristic Orchid faction, the Confederacy developed cruiser class vessels well before the Gathering did. Though the Vampweeds had little intention of wiping out their Floral counterparts, their more powerful fleet were able to even the playing field between the Orchid factions despite the population disparity, at least until the involvement of the Theocracy gave the Florals a massive advantage. Years later, cruisers like these provided substantial assistance to the Hive in the Federation-Mantis War. Nowadays they make for a rarer sight, with even more sophisticated Vampweed cruisers crowding them out.

CLASS: Geniocracy Cruiser FACTION: The Shell Geniocracy
The first Geniocracy cruisers designed were originally made with the Shell's interest in science and passion for experimentation first and foremost. These earlier models had almost luxurious amounts of space reserved for scientific activities, but virtually no offensive capabilities. However, when the threat posed by the Slugs became all too evident and impossible to ignore, the Geniocracy's cruisers were retrofitted with most of the offensive prowess that cruisers are known for. Though the Shells were still forced out of their home planet, these cruisers still prove sufficient to defend the nebulas they now call home.

CLASS: Republican Cruiser FACTION: The Eargen Republic
The Eargen Republic is known for many things, most of them undesirable. Fortunately, their ship building capabilities are one of the few good things going for them. The first cruisers of the Republic were commissioned by Aerkae during the Federation-Mantis War, as the changing battlefield of the conflict was better suited larger vessels. Unfortunately, after Aerkae's assassination, the proceeding president cut funding for the cruiser project to fund his luxurious lifestyle. It was only after Tyrdeo came to power that the cruisers were finally finished, as he tried to prove to his new Theocracy allies that the Republic was a worthwhile ally. As such, these cruisers typically avoid the same shoddiness that Leech vessels are often associated with.

CLASS: Coalition Cruiser FACTION: The Coalition
When the leaders of each of the Coalition's four comprising factions first met after its formation, the decision to have a new dedicated fleet for this alliance came quickly, presumably to match the Federation having a fleet of its own. While the Eargen Republic had less to offer than the other three members when it came to unique technology to implement into these new ships, their contributions came in the form of their vast shipbuilding prowess. These sleek ships utilize a wide selection of cutting-edge systems to augment their combat capabilities, with the cruisers having a reputation for being downright oppressive for many potential opponents in a direct fight. Despite these powerful ships, the Coalition is nowhere near the strength of the Federation or Rebellion, whatever they might say.

CLASS: Equinoid Transport FACTION: Flowers and Sunshine Studio
This cruiser is the vessel of choice for the leading character of the Ellie the Equinoid show, Ellie the Equinoid. The happy and whimsical show depicts Ellie exploring the galaxy, accompanied by a colorful cast of side characters like Remmy the Rekma and Sammy the Spider, the latter of which was eventually developed into a spin-off show that eclipsed the popularity of the original. Sadly, the original Ellie the Equinoid show is no longer in production, but its lead character has been spotted in the Union Coreworlds, according to several unreliable sources. The decision for each character to have their own cruiser may be a bit extravagant, but the excess of funds from Wentworth Innovations had to go into something.

CLASS: MFK Cruiser FACTION: Rebellion (Universe 0)
After the Rebellion discovered Multiversal travel, they set to work training up their finest supersoldiers within the universes where their victory had been secured. Naturally, they also needed a ship to transport them - and their home universes spared no expense to grant their finest soldiers a cruiser. Why do some MFK Cruisers come to work for the Federation and become Renegades? Once a soldier leaves their home universe, they may come to realize the galaxy that the Rebellion has created is not the galaxy that they prefer.

CLASS: Spider Hunter Cruiser FACTION: Exotic Hunter's Guild
Giant Alien Spiders are known to be some of the most deadly beasts in the galaxy. They are closely related to a much larger and even more deadly infestation, the Vek - and naturally the danger they pose, their speed and the rate at which they reproduce would attract the attention of hunters. Given the danger that they posed, hunters managed to rack up a decent amount of wealth by repelling infestations - enough even to construct their own dedicated cruisers.

CLASS: Angellic Deathbringer FACTION: The Syndicate
The Angellic Deathbringers are the largest and most powerful ships fielded by the Syndicate, used exclusively by their toughest and most brutal enforcers. The blueprints for this ship as well as other similar (albeit smaller) models were stolen from U1 by none other than Vael himself, though how he could've acquired them is a considerable mystery. Given the similarities to Federation stealth technology, there are some who have speculated that the Angellic Deathbringers may have originally been a Rebel counterpart to the Federation's own Stealth Cruisers.

CLASS: Osmian Cruiser FACTION: None (Owned by Osmian refugees)
Little information exists about the "Osmians" in the Federation database. They appear to hail from the original Zoltan homeworld of Osmia, and bear similar technology to the Zoltans, albeit more reminiscent of other races in the galaxy. Curiously though, the Zoltans do not appear to have made much official mention of the Osmians despite seemingly sharing a home planet with them. This apparent contradiction may be worth looking into.

CLASS: Sodium Cruiser FACTION: None (Owner unknown)
This cruiser appears to be the last remaining trace of the Saltmen, a race speculated to be a missing relative of the Rockmen and Crystals. Their home planet resided on the edge of a Dynasty sector, and some time before the Civil War their already diminished population was ravaged by a Guild hunting squad, to the point of presumed extinction. However, if the sightings of this cruiser are anything to go by, there may very well be survivors of this mysterious race out there.

CLASS: Sylvan's Cruiser FACTION: None (Owned by Sylvan)
The Travelling Merchant is a strange figure, known well across the Multiverse for boasting a ship far more powerful than what most others could ever aspire to. This firepower and defense is used to protect his stock in the face of otherwise greedy customers and adversaries. This description, of course, is not about Sylvan's own personal cruiser though, but rather his smaller transport ship. Why he rarely uses his cruiser is unknown, but could simply come down to it presenting a more powerful and thus less welcoming appearance. Presentation always matters in the business of selling goods, after all.

CLASS: Hektar Cruiser FACTION: Hektar Industries
Tired of pirates encroaching on your property? Rebel fleet getting you down? Have WE got just the deal for you! Hektar Industries is now introducing its brand new state of the art Hektar Cruiser! Hektar Cruisers are well worth the price, offering everything a standard Slug ship comes with and more! But that's not all! If you're in need of a little extra boost, the Hektar Cruiser includes highly convenient in-flight purchases, which offer the best weapons* on the market! *Some assembly required.

CLASS: Morph Cruiser FACTION: Unknown
Very little is known about the Morphs, other than that they are a failed experiment of the Shells. The ships they fly around in are almost certainly just larger Morphs, though how a Morph (or group of Morphs) could grow into them is still a mystery. Very rarely, they appear to be able to form even larger, cruiser sized ships. Unfortunately, with the unintelligible language of the Morphs, it appears that the answers to these questions will likely never be found.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_STATUS_CREW
event.text: When you recruit special crew, they will appear here.

PROFILE: Sherlock Haynes Titles: SDM (Standard Defense Militia) Detective, (Former) Multiverse Renegade Species: Human - Age: 36 - Gender: Male
Haynes was born a citizen of the Galactic Union on the infamous Antiquum Terrae. After his home was ravaged by blood thirsty, gigantic insects called the Vek, he left his past behind to seek out his dreams of becoming a detective for the Militia. He's fairly well known as a Multiverse Renegade, popping in to help various realities whenever he can. Unfortunately, he'll probably never get over his entomophobia, but his old-fashioned revolver was forged from the metal of an Alpha Scarab's shell as revenge.

PROFILE: Brodric Tully Title: Federation Admiral Species: Human - Age: 57 - Gender: Male
Tully is a man who lives up to his legend, if not more. Born to a penniless family of Union miners and orphaned by a Mantis attack, Tully has been serving in the Federation since the Federation first began. Maybe, if you survive this mission, Tully can sit you down and tell you some stories from his past. But for now, you have a Flagship ahead to prepare for and no time to lose.

PROFILE: Captain A5540L3 Title: Pirate King Species: Cognitive - Age: 8 - Gender: Male
A55 is one of the only three known cognitives in the galaxy, alongside CICA and the Harmony. Having been created by the Rebellion in an attempt to replicate CICA post-civil war, the engineers began to refer to the cognitive as A5540L3, though the AI managed to revolt and escape captivity, while keeping his title. How he became a pirate king is a bit hazy and A55 himself seems to have conflicted stories, but all that matters is he's on your side, and not the Rebellion's.

PROFILE: Jerome Wentworth Title: Rebel Officer Species: Human - Age: 23 - Gender: Male
Jerome, or "Jerry" as he prefers to be called, is the nephew to none other than Admiral Vance himself. He used to aspire to be just like his Uncle, but after an unpleasant experience with a raid against Orchid space he felt differently. Before he met you, he wasn't confident enough to stand up to Vance, but now he hopes he might be able to plead with the good side that he knows is in there and maybe put an end to this war.

PROFILE: Ellie the Equinoid Title: Children's mascot Species: Anthropomorphic Equinoid - Age: Hotly debated within the Ellie the Equinoid fan community - Gender: Female
Ellie the Equinoid is the star of a TV show from around a decade and a half ago. The show is quite acclaimed, and it's not difficult to find young adults who grew up on it. The individual in the costume is deft with a knife and extraordinarily bloodthirsty - though this is not true to the character as depicted in the TV show.

PROFILE: Stephan Title: Actor Species: Human - Age: 61 - Gender: Male
Stephan has been an actor since just out of his university days. He was not particularly well known until his breakout performance as Ellie the Equinoid just after the Federation-Mantis War. His particular choice in acting is often criticized for being too invested in the character - although the level of violence that he exhibited while he was in the role is unheard of.

PROFILE: T-RZ1L (Turzil) Title: (Former) Chief Defender of the Harmony Species: Engi - Age: 65 - Gender: N/A
Turzil was once the proud* General of the Engi Brigade, the Harmony's finest defenders. That is, until Universe 0 Turzil was caught breaking the non-aggression pact between the Harmony and the Rebellion, and sentenced to death alongside his entire squadron. The Harmonies, united across the Multiverse, declared Turzil an interdimensional fugitive. The bounty for him is so high he still isn't certain you won't turn him in. If he can prove himself a hero in this reality as well, maybe the Federation will grant him safety from the Harmony. (*This is a figure of speech. Engi cannot feel pride.)

PROFILE: Tintan Title: Ministry Envoy Species: Zoltan - Age: 53 - Gender: Female
Tintan is nothing but your ordinary Ministry representative - or at least she would be if it wasn't for the fact she's now stuck inside of Rig. Only Rig can hear what she says and the two are frequently arguing, but it's hard to say how much of that is because of their situation and how much is because they just can't agree with each other. Not that Tintan has much of a choice.

PROFILE: Anurak [last name unknown] Title: Monk of the Illesctrian Order, (Former) Duskbringer General Species: Zoltan - Age: 50 - Gender: Non-binary
Anurak used to be an influential figure in the Duskbringer cause. Death after death, his memory was worn away, leading to very scatterbrained mannerisms. After being accused of desertion, Anurak found faith and joined the Illesctrian Monks. Turned onto a person of peace, he would then cross paths with Sylvan, the traveling merchant, and befriend him. Eventually Anurak needed to feign death in order to escape assassins from his violent past. He fled to the last place anyone would think to look - a nebula in the heart of Duskbringer space.

PROFILE: Devorak "The Deathless" Rei Title: Duskbringer General Species: Zoltan - Age: 54 - Gender: Male
Devorak was once a devoted Zoltan Peacekeeper, but when he started to see cracks in the Ministry, he eventually jumped sides to the Duskbringers. Now that he's on your side, you've learned he never really liked either. The mysterious leaders of the Duskbringer movement tended to use him as an errand runner, rather than as the noble soldier who people assumed was associated with his title. With his glory days in both the Ministry and Duskbringers over, he figures it's high time he switches to the Federation for once.

PROFILE: Dr. Mafan Vadis Title: Co-chair of Astrophysics Research of Subset Academy (Sabbatical) Species: Zoltan - Age: 39 - Gender: Transfemme non-binary
Mafan has managed to put out an impressive number of papers considering their predilection for dangerous survey missions. Mafan will regail you at length about many scientific subjects, and sees no problem putting their life on the line if something novel can be learned from it. The scientific journals they hoard contain many sketches of ships, solar system charts, schematics, strange glyphs in other languages and citation notes for obscure papers. The Federation and Ministry both highly approve of your rescue of Mafan, as the information they have gathered could advance spacefairing technology by centuries... or it could be the death of you all.

PROFILE: Tiifleeiiik 'Freddy' Kitetiiikiplik Title: Free Mantis Founder Species: Mantis - Age: 65 - Gender: Male
Freddy is very reluctant to talk about his sensitive past, but you've managed to gather this much from him; he was once an engineer for the Hive attempting to flee from the industrial coreworlds of Tiet III along with various other Mantis scientists - the first Free Mantis. At some point Freddy met a human companion, an escapee from a nearby Mantis POW camp. From this man he earned his name and his excellent understanding of the human dialect. Freddy refused to use the synthetic pheromones that his fellow Free Mantis are known for, but understands that without the concoction his people would not last for very long.

PROFILE: Kazaaakplethkilik Tiiikazpakaziiika Titles: Honorary Suzerain, Pirate Species: Mantis - Age: 72 - Gender: Male
This Mantis pirate has more to his name than just his extensive count collection of letters. He is queen Leikonpliiinakra's chosen suitor. This relationship seems to be considered taboo by his people and many see him as a traitor after rumors of him acting as an informant for the Federation during the Fed-Mantis war got out. Now, he's spent his days campaigning against the Hive's involvement in the Coalition. Maybe there's more to this warrior than meets the eye?

PROFILE: Ariadne Obadann Title: Admiral of the Lost Suns Species: Rockman - Age: 27 - Gender: Female
Ariadne is quite young to be the leader of such an aggressive resistance movement, but her past is nothing but tragic. Since she was only 3, she was arranged into marriage with none other than the Head Elder Toarde by her own father to bestow even greater power on their family. Ariadne never married Toarde as she managed to escape with help of her much older brother, a former Crusader. Together the two formed the Lost Suns, but after a fallout because of their different views over the Crystal people, her brother vanished and Ariadne took full control.

PROFILE: Grand Priest Lord Vortigon Obadann XIV, Devout Follower and Leader of the Followers of the Eternal Ember and Keeper of the Holy Texts Title: Grand Priest and Devout Follower and Leader of the Followers of the Eternal Ember and Keeper of the Holy Texts Species: Rockman (Augmented) - Age: 38 - Gender: Male
Vortigon is... an interesting fellow. He took the words of the Elders to heart, and he believes in more than any other of the power of the Crystals. However, he wasn't a fan of the Elders themselves, so he, along with a band of several other Rockmen, set out to find the Crystalline Origins themselves. Somewhere along the way he went absolutely mad from overdosing on Crystalline stimulants, and you aren't sure why he's sticking with you. Maybe he's just so desperate for a friend he's willing to give anyone, even a Federation captain who almost killed him, a chance.

PROFILE: Rowbad 'Tuco' Eterrio Title: Dread Pirate, Private Bodyguard Species: Rockman - Age: 42 - Gender: Male
Once named Rowbad long ago, the now infamous Tuco carries the title of an ancient Rock Renegade during the days of the Rock-Crystal Empire. He's been on many adventures and is considered a hero by the Rock outcasts, but his glory days are long behind him. After being spoiled by the high-life as smuggler-king Ocym's private bodyguard, he spends most of his free time drunk aboard the Sky-Drifter Casino.

PROFILE: Rig Title: Zulfiqar Chief Marketing Officer Species: Rockman - Age: 65 - Gender: Male
Rig is a pretty important executive at Zulfiqar, so hopefully they don't mind what you've done to him. He seems to be in constant misery and always throwing up in the ship's toilet, much to the dismay of Tintan. Still, he refuses to seek help because of his stubborn determination to prove his perseverance... and also probably because he's absolutely terrified of surgery.

PROFILE: Empress Dianesh Kryel Title: Empress of the Crystalline Empire Species: Crystal - Age: 378 - Gender: Female
The Empress is older than the Federation itself, and has lived through the collapse of the Rock-Crystal Empire as well as the Federation Civil War. Through all of this it seems she has taken away one key thing - her people are rarely influenced positively by the skirmishes of foreign species. Being a skilled warrior herself, she has pledged her abilities to you to give your people a final chance. Try to impress her, or else the Crystalline-kind's stay in the new open Multiverse might be a very short one.

PROFILE: Sir Ruwen Argote Title: Foreign Ambassador of the Crystalline Empire Species: Crystal - Age: ??? - Gender: Male
Ruwen is the official Ambassador of the Crystalline Empire towards the outside world. Chosen for this position because of his unique role aboard the vessel that defeated the original Flagship, Ruwen has had a taste of both sides. Make no mistake, Ruwen's loyalty will always fall first on that of the Empire, but he is far from sharing the same xenophobic views as many other Crystals.

PROFILE: Gregory Nights Title: (Former) King of the Kleptocracy Species: Slug - Age: 48 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
The fact this drugged and drunk loser got to be king might be surprising, but he wasn't always this way. Always an asshole, yes, but Nights was once a revered pirate captain comparable to other famous names like Tuco or Kazaaakplethkilik. Being the son of two devout reformists, Nights always took a political tone to his work as a bounty hunter. Having become a cultural icon within the Kleptocracy during a time when Slocknog's expansion wars were growing even more unpopular, Nights took it upon himself to seize the crown. And yes, his real first name is Gregory.

PROFILE: Slocknog Dssilli Title: (Former) King of the Kleptocracy Species: Slug - Age: 48 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
Slocknog was once the king of the Kleptocracy not long ago, but he was also the one responsible for the infamous Slug Expansion Wars. These conflicts were greatly unpopular among the Slug people, which led to his eventual overthrowal in favor of Nights. Slocknog is adamantly against the Coalition, but also against the ideologies of Reformism that have led to such heavy human influence on Slug culture. If he had his way, the Slugs would remain their own entirely independent entity, and he's not afraid to make that known to anyone who'll listen.

PROFILE: Irwin Silza Titles: Multiverse Renegade, (Former) Exotic Hunters Guild Chairman Species: Slug - Age: 44 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
Irwin is one of the most famous Clansmen Rangers since the EHG was first formed. As a young child, he dreamed of being a Multiverse Renegade, but the Federation was too protective over this technology to let anybody, especially a Slug, get their hands (or tentacles) on it. The EHG looked like the only option to get a taste of adventure, and so his travels as a Clansman began. Apparently at some point he even was their chairman, but through circumstances he refuses to talk about, he was exiled.

PROFILE: Billy Hektar Title: CEO of Hektar Industries Species: Slug - Age: 49 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
Billy has done a lot of awful things, including slavery. Despite this, he can't be blamed entirely for them when he was held at gunpoint from one of the galaxy's most dangerous men. He also genuinely seems to regret his actions, especially concerning his long lost twin brother who used to run the company alongside him. Billy expects this mission to finally turn his life around, but maybe it's best not to tell him the Federation has no control over Kleptocracy tax collection.

PROFILE: Sylvan Title: Traveling Merchant Species: Slug - Age: 49 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
Basically nothing about Sylvan's past is clear, but it's hard to deny that he's always been your most loyal ally. You aren't certain what makes him like you so much, and sometimes it's even unnerving the lengths he'll go to help you, but it's good to have someone stand by you in the face of such adversities.

PROFILE: The Beacon Eater Title: Lanius King Species: Lanius - Age: ??? - Gender: N/A
The Beacon Eater has been the king of the Lanius for millenia. His body is covered in a thick cover of rust, and it's a miracle nothing has killed him over the three separate hibernations he's endured. Apparently, his swarm isn't the only one around, but he won't indulge further information.

PROFILE: The Anointed Title: Augmented Queen Species: Lanius (Augmented) - Age: ??? - Gender: Female
The Anointed was the first of the Augmented to split away from the Swarm. When she discovered the abundant food source in the recovery sites, she guided many fellow Lanius to this new oasis, so that they might avoid the long, dreadful hibernation that their species is often forced to go through. Her sudden change of heart seems to be attributed to her sense of mystery - she wants to figure this all out as much as you.

PROFILE: Dessius Yan Tartodicus Title: Prime Reaper of the Spectral Dynasty Species: Phantom Alpha - Age: 784 - Gender: N/A
Dessius is the 16th prime Reaper, and he's been around for a long time. So long, that he can remember a time before the Federation. Truth is, he knows there's more to the Auto-threat than that they're just 'demons', but he can't let his people know without mass panic. He's put his faith in your knowledge on CICA and the Flagship, and if your intel is right, you might finally be able to make peace between the Dynasty and Federation at long last.

PROFILE: Mayeb Title: Grand Gardener of Rt'lak Et Species: Ctl'Yae - Age: 35 - Gender: Female
Mayeb is a Grand Gardener of the Gathering's most prized Garden World. Mayeb was born with a rare deformity: She has a second, smaller head she calls P'erpah, who cannot speak except through Mayeb. Consequently, Mayeb is an outcast, spending all of her time tending to non-sapient flora. Due to her diligence, passion and bizarre outlook, her gardening skills became second to none. Despite being perceived as a freak and the isolation that came with it, she also became very skilled at navigating the politics of their world. According to Mayeb, this is due to P'erpah's knack for remembering and analyzing whatever political situations they encounter.

PROFILE: Ivar Title: Premier of the Vampweed Confederacy Species: 75% Oro'bache - Age: 40 - Gender: Male
Ivar is a peculiar Premier. He lacks the refined professionalism usually expected of politicians. Many mock him behind his back for his mannerisms and his dress choices. Despite this, Ivar's relations with the Geniocracy is widely regarded as a success, and the Confederacy has seen economic prosperity since he took office. He makes a point to resist any Coalition influence, as he does not trust the Theocracy. His greatest ambition is to unify the Orchid races.

PROFILE: Ty E'Rel Title: Inter-Kadahellian Ambassador Species: Oro'bache/Ctl'Yae hybrid - Age: 82 - Gender: Male
Ty E'Rel is a deeply serious Orchid, maintaining a professional distance from everyone he meets. A fervent proponent of peace, he is often called upon to write or edit any treaty or trade agreement involving both Kadahellian subspecies. In spite of his accomplishments, he does his best to avoid drawing attention to himself, preferring to let his work speak entirely for itself. His taciturn nature has led his aides to compete in how much they could make him emote. In his entire career, only one of them has ever managed to make him laugh.

PROFILE: Alkali Mardovar Title: Chief Science Officer of the Geniocracy Species: Shell - Age: 51 - Gender: Male
Professor Alkali, head of the Geniocracy science district, is not your friend. He is allegedly nobody's friend. An arrogant man and proud atheist, Alkali has a spiteful view on not only those outside of the Geniocracy but those inside the Geniocracy. Frankly, he'd much prefer he be left alone with his experiments. But now that his latest experiments have been foiled by the Rebellion and Nerva's sabotage, he's deadset on getting revenge. You're just his vessel for that. Or at least, so he claims.

PROFILE: Alkram Tripae Title: (Former) General of the Eargen Republic Species: Leech - Age: 56 - Gender: Male
Alkram was once the general of the Eargen Republic's military forces during the Federation-Mantis War under leadership of Aerkae. After his assassination and the Eargen Republic's distancing from the Hive, Alkram retired from the military and for several years watched as his people were flung into further turmoil until the appointment of Tyrdeo. Highly skeptical of Tyrdeo's motives, Alkram eventually decided it was time to take action and seize control of the Republic. He failed, as you already know, but he doesn't seem too bothered by it anymore.

PROFILE: Tyrdeo Poeka Title: (Former) President of the Eargen Republic Species: Leech - Age: 31 - Gender: Male
Apparently, Tyrdeo never wanted to be president of the Republic. Sort of. He was once a gardener for the wealthier Leech aristocrats and from them he gained many eccentric dreams of power. Seeing the opportunity, Tyrdeo began to parade himself as the best choice as Aerkae's replacement. This, for some reason, worked, and he was put in charge while failing to understand what his job as president was. He's an idiot, a coward, and very self-absorbed, but he's also strangely quite endearing and eager to prove himself.

PROFILE: Tony Senior Jr. Title: Founder and CEO of Tony's Species: Leech - Age: 40 - Gender: Male
This overweight and depressed Leech is the owner of perhaps the best known galactic retail chain in the galaxy, known simply as "Tony's". 7 years ago, he was a happy and fit man. Since that time, he has accrued a massive wealth, but he's also become a miserable wreck. He doesn't like to discuss his past, so anything more than this is a mystery.

PROFILE: Obyn Arokem Title: Multiverse Renegade Species: Saltman - Age: 50 - Gender: Male
Obyn is, as far as he knows, the last of his kind. After seeing his family massacred by the EHG, he's sworn to hunt down and kill every last Clansman involved. In the meantime though, he makes a pretty penny as a bounty hunter. He has a long and complicated past with Sylvan from what you understand, but he doesn't talk about it much. It seems personal, so it's better not to ask too much.

PROFILE: Aenwithe Title: Obelisk Revolutionary, (Former) Cognitive Engineer Species: Obelisk - Age: Roughly 80000 - Gender: N/A (culturally male)
Aenwithe is a friendly (if not somewhat narcissistic), well spoken (if not overly talkative), and most certainly well traveled Obelisk. He was once an engineer working on the Harmony project until he defected after what he refers to as the "Prometheus Incident." Now, he's determined to make true the ancient myths of the Paragon and destroy the Multiverse to ensure the security of civilization.

PROFILE: ??? Title: Giant Alien Spider Queen Species: Giant Alien Spider - Age: 24 - Gender: Female
The Queen, while not the only way for the spiders to reproduce, produces the bulk of the future spider offspring through laying eggs in massive underground hatcheries, or in storage cabinets on your ship. You expected this massive, untamed beast to cause more problems aboard your ship, but she mostly sleeps or playfully romps around the ship, when she isn't busy devouring your enemies alive that is.

PROFILE: Guntput Title: Tribal Warrior Species: Furry One Eyed Tree Lizard Thing - Age: ??? - Gender: Male
When the Hektar vessels first arrived on the lizard homeworlds, many of the lizards were amazed by their wonderous technology. No one listened to Guntput's warnings, no thanks to Metyunt, a prominent friend of the tribe's chieftain, who sided with Hektar since the beginning. When the lizards began to be shipped away to work in the Mega-Market only then did the Lizards realize the truth to Guntput's words. Now, the last few remaining lizards see modern technology as an all encompassing evil, but Guntput trusts you just enough to give you a chance.

PROFILE: Metyunt Title: Hektar Manager Species: Furry One Eyed Tree Lizard Thing - Age: 29 - Gender: Male
Metyunt is a traitor to his people and a coward at that. When the Hektar ships first arrived on his home planet, he was quick to strike a deal with Hektar in return for his own liberty. However, it's clearly taken a toll on him, and now he's desperate to find a way to repay for his crimes.

PROFILE: OOJ MAJOO Title: Big blob thing Species: Morph - Age: ??? - Gender: N/A
Every Morph you've ever seen has all been but a piece of OOJ. In a sense, they are all him. Yet, they act individually. The large grey blob whom the "true" OOJ gave to you is nothing but another, larger fragment of his eternally growing and dividing colony of Morphs. You might not know what he's saying, but fortunately he can understand you and clearly has the best of intentions.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_STATUS_LOOT
event.text: When you raid (crew kill) a special loot transport, the sector you found them in will appear here.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_REAL
event.text: You look around for one of your crew to talk to.

choice.text: Mount Jerry on your tamed Equinoid.

event.text: Jerry climbs onto the horse...

choice.text: Mount Jerry on your crystal Equinoid.

event.text: Jerry climbs onto the horse...
Jerry gets off of his horse...
Jerry gets off of his horse...

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_VORTIGON
textList.text: As you approach Vortigon, he begins to laugh menacingly. Uncertain, you back slowly out of the room and close the door behind you.
Vortigon is busy contemplating if he should change the color of his robes.
Vortigon brags about how cool his name is, and insults your 'pathetic' name. According to him, the name's length is what matters most.
Vortigon hopes that the crew of other Federation ships have more style and class than yours.
Vortigon appears to be under-way with some sort of strange ritual. As long as he isn't summoning any demons, you're ok with it.
Vortigon wonders what other lifeforms he might be able to convert into his cult now that he has left the Crystalline Homeworlds.
Vortigon makes it clear time and time again that he finds you disgusting. Why did we let this guy onto the ship?
Vortigon is busy cooking some sort of strange stew made with the blood of virgins.
Vortigon briefly mentions something about a rival cult, whose name sounds something similar to 'Mar', whose been stealing their recruits for some time. He doesn't sound very happy about it.
Vortigon never wants to see another damn teal ship ever again. Something about some 'Elder Cult', but he won't say anything more.
Vortigon hates being slow. He also hates tripping over his cloak. Come to think of it, he seems to hate a lot of things.
Vortigon wants to meet the Zoltan Minister some day. He thinks the Zoltan race would make an excellent addition to his cult.
Vortigon is busy writing another chapter for the Ember Holy Texts.
Vortigon requests that you make it mandatory for all crew members to memorize his scripture. You refuse.
Vortigon randomly quotes a verse from his holy texts, and then tries to explain the significance behind it.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_RUWEN
textList.text: You question Ruwen about his seemingly routine early morning stretches. "Well, it's no secret that cryosleep does anything but wonders to your body! Spend a couple decades in a chamber and, well... well I don't quite remember how you foreigners say it. Rigid as a wooden plank?"
You find Ruwen redoing the coat of golden paint over his body. You aren't actually sure what color of crystal Ruwen is underneath, but you're also uncertain if it's rude to ask.

Ruwen runs you through various common phrases in his language, but most are lost on you. It's almost like someone just stuck a bunch of syllables together with no rhyme or reason and called it an alien language!

You're impressed to find Ruwen tinkering with a couple devices on the ship, trying to improve their efficiency or repair damage from combat, though you'll have to get used to his foreign expletives whenever something goes wrong.
Ruwen's surprised how little Crystalline culture has evolved since he was freed from cryosleep. He supposes a century or two of complete isolation would do that to a society though.
You find Ruwen's room decorated by a number of oddities, personal reminders of his homeland. Several of them seem to be effigies of Dianesh, the empress. You don't ask him about it.

Ruwen plucks a golden shard from his arm and hands it to you. "In our tradition, this is symbolic for a wish of good health and protection. Should danger approach, you may plunge this into the throat of your enemies."

Ruwen still has so many places he wishes to visit someday. The Dynasty, for both its art and its military prowess, the Shells to witness the extent of their scientific advancement, and the Free Mantis because they talk funny.

Ruwen struggles with addressing different species properly. He once got himself into a life threatening situation after he took a Slug's advice and called a Mantis Suzerain a '5-eyed corpse humper'. "I see now why everyone warns me never to trust a Slug."

You find Ruwen carrying a box marked 'fragile' from the cargo bay into his quarters - something he brought aboard when he first joined your crew. "This, my friend, is Ryapel. It's the chemical stimulant we Crystals use to accelerate geode growth. Be very careful around it, it can cause some... unpleasant side effects to non-crystal biology."

Ruwen admires the colorful culture of the Mantis. "It's truly a shame that these insectoids are so hostile. My people do not practice any forms of dancing, and I would have loved to learn from them were it not that they would certainly harvest my organs at the first opportunity."

Ruwen shares with the crew an ancient Crystal legend of a sacred vault built within the caverns of the perilous world of Alcyrea. Though travel to Alcyrea was forbidden by the Empire, with their secret homeworlds now abandoned Ruwen wonders if someday someone might finally put the myth to the test.

It seems Ruwen is still troubled by that one time he called you an 'alien'. "I am truly, so terribly sorry. It's so unlike me, I... it just tears me up inside!" You tell him not to worry about it, but it doesn't seem to soothe him much.

Ruwen's always been one for adventure. Before his job as the ambassador he was eager to sign up to join the crew of a new settlement on the rim of the Rock-Crystal Empire. Then, you know, cryosleep happened and he woke up several centuries later.

Ruwen remarks on the incredible dramatic timing at which Renegades always seem to arrive just in time whenever something important is happening. The same thing happened to him, when his station was near destruction and the Federation Hero saved him just in time.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_DIANESH
textList.text: Out of curiosity, you inquire just how the Elders scrubbed all traces of the Crystals so efficiently. Dianesh laughs. "It's a common misconception among foreigners that the Crystals and Rockmen lived closely throughout all of the Rock-Crystal Empire. Our two civilizations were spread apart by the length of several systems, and we Crystals have always been isolationists. The Elders didn't have to try very hard to chase us away because we were barely here to begin with."

Dianesh, at your request, explains why the Empire is... well, an Empire. "The adoption of the imperial title stems all the way back to the Rock-Crystal Empire. Even after the isolation of our people, we maintained and regulated a number of colonies and outer territories in what you usually refer to as dead space. It's a miracle it took you foreigners so long to find us."

"You'd be surprised to find much of the history of our people is as mysterious and lost to us as it is to you. It seems there was some kind of extinction level event in the past, something that wiped the entire origins of our people and split up our species. I can only wonder what..."

You begin to ask Dianesh another question about Crystalline history, but she stops you. "Please. Try asking me about something that isn't history related. I have other things to say besides spouting exposition."

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_SALT
textList.text: Obyn misses the days when he could just freely go about melting Clansmen. Being a Federation hero has its perks, but it also means you can't just go committing warcrimes. Probably.
Obyn reflects on the missed opportunity to call his 2nd mate "pepper".
Obyn wonders if his prized Salt launchers would be considered illegal by the Federation if they find out about them. He begs you never to tell anyone.
"Ever notice how the Clansmen change their accent with nearly every bit of dialogue? It's kinda creepy..."

Obyn might be big, rough, and violent, but he has a soft spot for poetry. His latest work is simply titled "I'd rip the eyes out of a hatchling's head and eat them with chopsticks for you." How romantic?
Obyn isn't sure if he hates Rebels or Slugs more. His character arc hasn't included Rebels until this point, but it just seems like everyone hates Rebels instinctually except the Rebels themselves.
Obyn is ashamed of both the Rock and Crystalline societies. He doesn't want to get into the specifics though, because politics and such.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_SYLVAN
textList.text: You inquire why Sylvan persistently calls you stranger instead of your real name. Sylvan explains he's trying to avoid what he refers to as an 'immersion break'.
You ask Sylvan if he sells to anyone - even Rebels. Sylvan says yes, but a sly smirk suggests his other clients might not get the same preferential treatment as you.
Sylvan won't elaborate on his encounters with other Renegades, nor even the possibilities with encounters with himself. Strange, considering he normally has so many stories to tell.

You can't find Sylvan anywhere on the ship, but you suspect he might be in his quarters. Unfortunately, you wouldn't dare step foot in that room even with his permission. Some things you simply aren't meant to see.

For a brief moment you catch Sylvan leaving his quarters and spot a strangely shaped obloid object on the floor. Sylvan eyes you, and merely says "Don't assssk quesstions you don't want the anssswer to, sssstranger."

Sylvan frequently amuses the other crew with fantastical stories of mythical beasts, hidden sectors, and elusive mercenaries. You ask him about the authenticity of these stories, and he admits most of them are made up. "Ssssometimesss, ssstranger, a made up ssstory isss easier to grassssp than the truth."
You find Sylvan smoking on the bridge, away from the rest of the crew. It's strange to see him doing so, but at least he has the courtesy to do it in private.
Though you wouldn't dare enter, you can hear Sylvan speaking inside the ship restroom. Sounds like he's reciting different ways of saying "sssstranger."
"Sssstranger, have you ever heard the tale of Darth Plagueis the Wisssse? No? Ahhh too bad. What'ssss wrong, expecting ssssomething elssse?"

"Jussst ssso you know Ssstranger, you're my favorite ssstranger of all the ssstrangers I've ever had the pleasure or displeasure of meeting!" You think that's a compliment, but you aren't entirely sure.
You notice Sylvan walking around the ship without his signature outfit on. It seems so out of place, but considering most Slugs don't wear clothes at all, you suppose this would be normal to most.
You notice Sylvan's been stealing salt packets from the cafeteria. You feel like you should confront him or at least ask him what he's doing with all of them, but you know better.
Sylvan pulls you aside and hands you a small revolver with a pack of bullets crafted from fine silver. He warns: "Ussse thisss only in casssse of emergency, ssstranger."
You question Sylvan why he dress the way he does. He claims he stole it from another fellow, a human, during his era as a pirate. It's also where he adopted his signature "ssstranger" tik.
You find it strange Sylvan paints his ship like a pirate yet doesn't fly a pirate flag. According to him, he once did, but he's since scrubbed it away as well as all the memories attached to it.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_REAPER
textList.text: Dessius reads you a few lines from a poem he wrote. Halfway through he starts crying, and it's clear its a very emotional piece to him. It's just a shame you'll never know why, because you forgot to bring your translator and have no idea what the poem says.

You ask Dessius why the Ghosts all speak so... fancy. "Ah, the answer is most simple. Have you ever heard a Mantis, those violent insectoids, and their choppy barbaric language? Well to themselves it must sound brilliant and smooth! But to us, it sounds imbecilic. Well, much a same effect occurs on your translators with our static."
You finally work up the courage to ask Dessius how Ghost anatomy works, but he just breaks out laughing. "AHAHAHAHAHHAHAHAHAHAHAHAH, my friend don't be silly!" and floats away.
Dessius sometimes wonders what he must look like to people who haven't a clue what the Ghosts are. A floating set of armor surrounded by some pink gas isn't a very usual sight.
Dessius wonders what a 'samurai' is, and why he keeps seeing people compare him to one.

Dessius humors the silly names that explorers and translators have given the Ghosts and their various titles. A better translation of 'Prime Reaper' would be Eldane Prodalccius. But where's the fun in that?

Dessius comes from a long line of long-named Ghosts. The Dynasty has only had 16 Prime Reapers in its time, and Dessius's bloodline has been in charge since the 7th Reaper. A Ghost will usually divide 10 to 12 times before they finally dissipate, which can make choosing an heir difficult.

Dessius has little worries about the seemingly problematic overpopulation issues that the Dynasty experiences. "Every year thousands of the most devoted zealots line up for their ceremonious plunging into the heart of the nebula to become one with the cosmos. It's wide scale population control without my own fingers ever once needing lifting."

Dessius confesses that his full name is actually "Anglicus Dessius Probission-Taledemy." For the longest time he assumed he had the longest name around, until he heard word of some Rockman cult leader who rivaled even him.

Dessius worries greatly about CICA's Auto invasion and the sphere of influence that the troublesome AI is slowly growing. You try to explain CICA isn't actually sentient, just controlled by Vance, but Dessius won't listen.
"Have you ever laid sight upon a ship such as the Dreadnaught from earlier? Nay, neither have I. Mine conscience struggles to comprehend what horrors might lie in the devilish mind of Vance."

"Stay at my side, friend, and the swift strike of my sword shall prove the setting sun that none before us shall last lest they fall to their knees and cry the holy words of mercy which appease us!" You aren't even sure if you know what that means, but it sounds endearing.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_ANOINTED
textList.text: The Anointed promises they are not a cult leader. They advise you not to ask about it any further.
The Anointed informs you that "The Anointed" is their real name that they were given at birth. It's only pure coincidence that they ended up where they are now.
The Anointed advises you avoid making any racist allusions about the Lanius or Ancient hierarchies.
The Anointed repeatedly reminds you to always capitalize the "The" at the start of their name.
The Anointed is very picky about what scrap they'll eat. You can't understand caring when you're already eating space trash, but to each his own.
The Anointed swallows a massive chunk of scrap metal right in front of you, then walks away. You aren't sure if you just walked in at a bad time or if they were trying to make a point.
The Anointed appreciates you saving them, and offers you a small trinket made out of its own body matter. You warily accept it, and put it in the farthest corner of your room that you can.
The Anointed shares a story of when they ate an entire Dynasty warship before they became the leader of the Augmented. You're glad to have her on your side.
The Anointed calls dibs on everything in the cargo bay, should the mission be abandoned.
The Anointed is enjoying a nice glass of liquid magma in their quarters. You decide not to intrude on them.
The Anointed is busy sharpening their blades. They discourage you come any closer until the process is finished.
You find yourself warning the Anointed about eating the fuel cells for the 30th time since they joined your crew after you catch them in the act yet again.
The Anointed is thinking of new synonyms to describe itself, and finds the thesaurus to be largely unhelpful.
The Anointed isn't sure how to remove the lights stuck along its body, or how they got there in the first place.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_EATER
textList.text: The Beacon Eater once met the leader of a second swarm somewhere long long ago. Someday they'll meet again, and probably kill each other.
The Beacon Eater has gone by many nicknames, but his all time favorite is "baconator."

The Beacon Eater has trapped himself accidentally at many a beacon before. Fortunately, the Lanius move around so much, it's not too long until they find him again. The longest he's ever been stranded was a year, no big deal.
The Beacon Eater's diet is insatiable. It's a high price, but a worthy one when it means he gets to look so damn cool.
The Beacon Eater explains the process of designing his own form. The stage it struggled the most over was the eyes. There was over 20 options at one point!
The Beacon Eater does not exclusively eat beacons, contrary to what his name suggests. Sometimes he eats a ship or two instead.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_WITHER
textList.text: Wither is frustrated that half of the lines mentioning him say "Wither" and the other half say "Aenwithe".
Wither promises you that if his name was to be an easter egg, the guy it refers to is very cool. You have no idea what that means.
Wither asks you what version number we're on. You're confused, but he seems to realize something and apologizes, then leaves the room.
"Wouldn't it be funny," begins Wither, "If there was a super secret ending where Slugs take over the galaxy? Hah, not like that exists..."
Wither misses Larry. When you ask who Larry is, he mumbles something about Slug popcorn, Mantis Bishops trying to breathe, and the Great Eye.
Wither will never forgive the Augmented for what they did to his fleet. At least, not until you start a new run and do the quest all over again.
Wither complains about the rendering time for 1080p videos to render. The things that this guy says will forever be a mystery to you...
"I wonder what Wither thinks when he reads these. Assuming he reads them, of course." You aren't sure how to respond, considering you thought HE was Wither.
Wither complains about the intricacies of time travel and the danger of paradoxes. He's already destroyed a couple realities because he accidentally said hello to himself.
Wither thinks he'll become a youtuber in some alternate timeline. You nod your head, though you have no idea what youtube is.
Wither encourages using his ability to race him against the other crew. Not that it's practical, but it is fun for a couple seconds.
Wither wonders why the corpses disappear when crew die. If they're being taken, then for what purpose...?

Wither encourages you to join the Discord. You don't know what a Discord is, but if you did, the invite link would probably be on the Subset forums, under the Mod category, on the Multiverse page. Not that you would know.
Wither claims he once dared utter the phrase "MLG Pro." Even you hate the sound of that, and you don't even know what it means.
Wither apologizes if all of his dialogue goes over your head. You just aren't cultured enough to understand it.
Wither wants you to promise never to press the Panic Button, ever, under any circumstances. If you don't know what this means yet, you will eventually.
